column4: Hi there, I currently have a drive in my machine that i need to mount
how could I check which file system its using?
dont i need something more specific than that in order to mount the drive?
thanks, trying that now

and now since the first harddrive has been mounted, can i check and make sure which file system it is because i need to actually replicate these drives exactly. I am trying to make a copy between the two
I was thinking about using 'dd' what would you say is the best method?
yes, do i need them to be mounted to use dd?
no
in order to use dd, would i need to format the new file system?
no... dd copies bit-by-bit...
but don't forget to set a high enough bs(blocksize)... otherwise it will last forever ^^
how would i set the blocksize?
im currently doing something like this:dd if=/dev/sdc1 of=/dev/sdb .. but haven't started it yet
one last question
ive run dd from a drive with a file system to another drive which has no file system
is that ok?
or should i have formatted the drive to empty status before running dd to give it a file system?
yes ... dd copies everything, no matter what...
oh thanks a lot! was just making sure
formatted partitions are also just bits on the disk... they will be overwritten by dd
im running dd with a blocksize of 32768k and the drives are both 1.5TB each, how long could we guess this should usually take?
hmm... one hour? two? ... depends, how fast the connection is
